Review Title: Lacks the homey feel of a really good hostel.
Negative Reviews:
Staying at this hostel was a bag of mixed feelings for me. Everything is in place for it to be a great hostel, but somehow it made me feel like I was a  product being processed or a part traveling through a conveyor belt in a factory. It felt to me as though no one at the hostel ever took the time to think about the user experience of a guest. 

Let me give some examples; 
For reasons unknown to me, you can’t lock toilets. 
You share one key for a dorm room that sleeps six. 
The bunk beds are super high up. And don’t have supports to prevent you from falling out. I’m not squeamish but it actually felt uncomfortable to sleep in the top bunk. 
Speaking of the top bunk - there was nowhere to put any of your things. Not even a phone. I ended up sleeping with mine under the pillow. 
Climbing up and down was difficult. 
Chargers weren’t international - which is a small thing, but it’s the first hostel in Argentina that I’ve tried where i couldn’t charge my phone. 
None of the furniture was comfy. It somehow wasn’t nice to sit anywhere. 
And breakfast was like being in a busy high school canteen. They managed to run out of glasses too. And I’m assuming they provide the same service every day, so that shouldn’t be too difficult to fix.
